page.title: 03THE PARISH CHURCH.
page.content: The Parish Church is dedicated to {St. Jude,}and is reputed to have been built by the first{Lord Tollemache}in 1836 - the same year as the school. It is rather unusual in that it is built North to South instead of East to West, as is the usual custom for a Church. The reason given for this is that{Admiral Tollemache -}father of Lord Tollemache - wished to walk through his own entrance gates of {Tilstone Lodge}and straight into the Church. It is built of stone with a slated roof - wood panelled on the inside.The interior is simply furnished.The organ is situated in the balcony at the rear of the Church. The present incumbent is the{Rev. A. {Reece}who became Vicar of the Parish in 1980 following the death of the previous Vicar -{Canon A.D. James.
